With the new schedule, there are no announced plans for a major "standalone" set like Origins that is not part of a block.

Name: Zen Monkeys
Description:
The Monkey King Sun Wukong has decreed that his disciples, the monkeys of Flower and Fruit Mountain, must create a kingdom worthy of his status as Great Sage, Equal of Heaven. To do so each monkey must tame the mountain by following the Six Principles of Zen; forging paths, directing streams, and arranging features such as fruit trees, lanterns and statues that will most please King Monkey. In addition, Sun Wukong demands that all monkeys must help to build him a shrine on top of the mountain. Not all of the mountain monkeys agree with Sun Wukong however and some patrol the forest, ready to catch unwary monkeys.

In Zen Monkeys players each have a monkey Disciple, creating their part of Sun Wukong's kingdom on the mountain. Each round player monkeys search the Wilds for placeable 'feature' resources or collect landscape tiles to shape their forest into a puzzle-like network of paths and streams. Searching along paths in the Wilds has a noise penalty that triggers the approach of the grey guardian monkeys who will chase and eject any monkeys found collecting. Sneaky monkeys will be able to collect and place these resources in their landscapes to best please King Monkey, following the set of objectives he has set them for the game. Collectable resources are scarce so the monkeys will have to landscape their part of the forest carefully and be ready to grab point-scoring features before their rivals can.

After two full moon phases, the game ends and King Monkey appears to judge the most impressive landscapes of his new kingdom. Points are scored on the sets of features placed in each area, the adherence to the 6 zen principles and for the specific tasks assigned by King Monkey.

—description from the publisher

Name: Skull Tales: Full Sail! – The Twins
Description: Two miniatures of the twin children characters, which will be handled by a single player, with 2 character cards and exclusive equipment.

Name: King of Tokyo/New York: Monster Pack – Cybertooth
Description:
Cybertooth — a giant two-legged robot that can transform into a fearsome sabertoothed tiger — is about to hit the town! Infused with the power of the ancient berserkers, Cybertooth will settle for nothing less than the tiger's share! Will you, too, succumb to the berserker fury?

The Cybertooth Monster Pack introduces a new game component: the berserk die! You can use the berserk die in your games even if you play without Evolution cards or are not playing with Cybertooth.

The Cybertooth Monster Pack is compatible with the King of Tokyo and King of New York base games, and with all their expansions.

Part of the King of Tokyo series.

Name: Skull Tales: Full Sail! – The Dynamic Duo
Description: Composed of two miniatures: the dwarf musician and the bodyguard. Each miniature comes with its character card, marker, team cards and PvP card. The dwarf musician is equipped with two bladed pistols and a lute, and the bodyguard with a scimitar.

Name: Dust 1947: Spetsnaz Army Box
Description:
The elite forces of the SSU Spetsnaz are seasoned veterans infamous throughout the World of Dust for their courage, tactical skills, and heavy firepower. Fielding these fierce soldiers along with their modern equipment in battle makes the Spetsnaz one of the deadliest force on the planet, one that everyone rightfully fears.

This Army Box is a great way to expand your Spetsnaz force and is awesome with Battlegroup Roza, the Spetsnaz Starter Set (SU002) and the Spetsnaz Headquarters (SU435). All these combined will give you a great army!
In this box you'll find:
- one Spetsnaz Saboteur Squad (5 miniatures)
- one Spetsnaz Kill Squad (5 miniatures)
- one Spetsnaz Sniper Squad (2 miniatures)
- one Spetsnaz Invader Helicopter (1 aircraft)
Even if these are Spetsnaz Units, they can be added to any SSU force, making it even deadlier!

This reference comes with four Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each Unit, for the Spetsnaz Faction of the SSU Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, these come already assembled and primed. They are ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Dust 1947: Allied Rangers Army Box
Description:
The Allied Army is the largest military force on the planet, by all numbers: soldiers, tanks, walkers, planes, ships. But it's also the one that has to defend its values on the most fronts, fighting all over a World that wants Allied wealth and resources and that is jealous of its freedom. Within the Allied Army, the Rangers are special forces -elite soldiers that carry on the most difficult tasks.

This Army Box is a great way to expand your Allied Army and is awesome when paired with the Heavy Ranger Starter Set (AL008) and the Heavy Ranger Headquarters (AL141). In this box you'll find:
- one Heavy Ranger Attack Squad (3 miniatures)
- one Heavy Ranger Tank-Hunter Squad (3 miniatures)
- one Ranger Heavy Mortar Squad (4 miniatures)
- one Bulldog Walker (1 walker)
Even if these are Allied Bloc Units, they can be added to any Allied Faction, making it even deadlier!

This reference comes with four Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each Unit, for the Allied Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, these come already assembled and primed. They are ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Dust 1947: USMC Army Box
Description:
When all the Allied Nations joined forces to become the Allies, all their armed forces mixed into the largest military structure on the planet. Except the United States Marine Corps, who said 'no thanks, we'll remain the USMC' but welcomed everyone into its ranks. Wherever the Allies fight, the Marines are here, always on the toughest spot.

This Army Box is a great way to expand your United States Marine Corps force and is awesome when paired with the USMC Starter Set. In this box you'll find:
- one USMC Anti-Tank Squad (5 miniatures)
- one USMC War Dogs Recon Squad (5 miniatures)
- one USMC Heavy Engineer Squad (3 miniatures)
- one Barking Dog (Light) Walker (1 walker)
Even if these are USMC Units, they can be added to any Allied force, making it even deadlier!

This reference comes with four Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each Unit, for the USMC Faction. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, these come already assembled and primed. They are ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Dust 1947: Luftwaffe Army Box
Description:
The elite forces of the Luftwaffe are seasoned veterans infamous throughout the World of Dust for their courage, tactical skills, and heavy firepower. Fielding these fierce soldiers and modern equipment in battle makes the Luftwaffe one of the deadliest force on the planet, one that everyone rightfully fears.

This Army Box is a great way to expand your Luftwaffe force and is awesome with the Luftwaffe Starter Set (AX008) and the Luftwaffe Headquarters (AX433). All these combined will give you a great army! In this box you'll find:
- one Fallschirmjäger Tank-Hunter Squad (5 miniatures)
- one Fallschirmjäger Battle Squad (5 miniatures)
- one Fallschirmjäger Missile Squad (2 miniatures)
- one Geist (1 aircraft)
Even if these are Luftwaffe Units, they can be added to any Axis force, making it even deadlier!

This reference comes with four Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each Unit, for the Luftwaffe Faction of the Axis Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, these come already assembled and primed. They are ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Dust 1947: NDAK Army Box
Description:
The elite forces of the Neue Deutsches Afrikakorps (NDAK) are seasoned veterans infamous throughout the World of Dust for their courage, tactical skills, and heavy firepower. Fielding these fierce soldiers and modern equipment in battle makes the NDAK one of the deadliest force on the planet, one that everyone rightfully fears.

This Army Box is a great way to expand your Neue Deutsches Afrikakorps force and is awesome with the NDAK Starter Set (AX002) and the NDAK Headquarters (AX335). All these combined will give you a great army!
In this box you'll find:
- one Grenadier Tank-Hunter Squad (5 miniatures)
- one Grenadier Recon Squad (5 miniatures)
- one Grenadier Heavy Mortar Squad (4 miniatures)
- one Loki Tropical Anti-Aircraft Walker (1 walker)
Even if these are NDAK Units, they can be added to any Axis force, making it even deadlier!

This reference comes with four Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each Unit, for the NDAK Faction of the Axis Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, these come already assembled and primed. They are ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Dust 1947: BlutKreuz Army Box
Description:
The dreaded forces of the BlutKreuz Korps are infamous throughout the World of Dust for their cunning, brutality, and unchecked use of weird experiments and cutting edge technology. Fielding zombies and laser weapons in battle makes the BlutKreuz Korps (or Blood Cross Corps) one of the deadliest force on the planet, one that everyone fears.

This Army Box is a great way to expand your BlutKreuz Korps force and is awesome when paired with the BlutKreuz Korps Starter Set. In this box you'll find:
- one Zombie Squad (5 miniatures)
- one Zombie Suicide Squad (5 miniatures)
- one Heavy Grenadier Tank Hunter Squad (3 miniatures)
- one Wotan II Laser Walker (1 walker)
Even if these are BlutKreuz Korps Units, they can be added to any Axis force, making it even deadlier!

This reference comes with four Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each Unit, for the BlutKreuz Korps Faction. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, these come already assembled and primed. They are ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Dust 1947: Avatar of Cthulhu
Description:
The Great Dreamer is back. A catastrophic chain of events started under the sands of Babylon has brought back one of the most terrific foe Humanity has ever faced: the mighty Cthulhu. A part of this creature's essence has materialized in the form of an Avatar, a powerful representation of the Deity on Earth. After centuries of slumber, it can once again advance the cause of the Mythos forces on our planet, getting ready for a final battle it knows is coming.

The Avatar of Cthulhu has been sculpted by Joaquin Palacios, one of the World's most famous sculptor. This reference comes with its own Dust 1947 unit card, for the Mythos Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Dust 1947: Mercenary Wrecker/Demolisher/Obliterator
Description:
Mercenary walkers are made of whatever the Sisters can get their hands on. But thanks to the top mechanics in their ranks, they make some of the most awesome war machines on the planet!
The Wrecker is a dedicated anti-aircraft walker made from SSU and Axis parts, with a Mercenary twist.
The Demolisher has identical weapons, plus a little extra, and is the personal mount of ace Mercenary pilot Luisa.
The Obliterator also combines SSU and Axis weapons, but this time to blow up tanks! Or anything on the ground that foolishly gets too close.
This reference allows you to field one of these three variants.

As with any Mercenary units, these walkers can be attached to any force in Dust 1947. Please note that all weapons options are included in this box, as well as the pilot (in resin) and the recoiless gun.

This reference comes with three Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already pre-assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Dust 1947: Spetsnaz Aleksei/Nadya
Description:
Armed with two Gatling guns, the Aleksey (Tsh) is a staple of SSU forces around the planet. This tropicalized variant is used by the dreaded Spetsnaz, who enjoy the firepower and versatility of this walker. The Nadya (Tsh) is deadly at close range thanks to its powerful flamethrowers. This reference allows you to field one of these two variants.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, both for the Spetsnaz Faction of the SSU Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Dust 1947: IJN Ryu II/Ryu III Heavy Walker
Description:
The Ryu was the first walker developed specifically for the Imperial Japanese Armed Forces, with great help from the Central Axis powers, especially Germany. Assembled on the powerful chassis of the PanzerKampfLäufer III, it has become the most common walker in the Japanese arsenal. The second version is very similar to the original Ryu with its laser guns, but also has a machine-gun for close infantry defense. The third version, Ryu III, mounts two impressive rail guns, from Japanese design. This reference allows you to field one of these two variants.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, both for the IJN Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Dust 1947: Desert Scorpions Headquarters
Description:
The Desert Scorpions of the Long Range Desert Group (LRDG) are a formidable elite unit of the Allied Army, made from soldiers from every country of this grand Nation. Their hit and run tactics, supported by great vehicles and weapons, make them the deadliest opponents anyone can face, especially in the depths of the desert.

The Desert Scorpions Headquarters includes the following Units:
- Gregory & Izzy
- Marek
- Bull's Eye
- Desert Scorpions Command Squad

This reference comes with four Dust 1947 unit cards, each for the Desert Scorpions Faction. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, they come already assembled and primed. They are ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on them, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Brink
Description:
Players compete to balance exploitation and conservation in an effort to save endangered species from the brink of extinction. To do this, players must accumulate money through the collection and selling of resources in order to then buy and conserve land. To collect resources, players must exploit the land, and potentially push species to extinction. Players take the role of advisers to the Minister for the Environment - choosing when to approve requests for resource projects (collecting resources for doing so) and choosing which companies to give the approved contracts to (owned by other players, or themselves - who also collect resources). The role of the Minister is to conserve species, therefore the adviser that enables the best conservation of species wins the game! The game ends when either 15 species are saved, or 6 are made extinct.

The setup for the game is always randomized: The lands are arranged at random, in addition to the location of the endangered species; The resource cost to improve the efficiency of exploited lands is randomized; and the resource cost to move species, create habitat bridges and recycle waste is also randomized.

The board consists of 4 separate land types (Plains, Oceans, Mountains, Forests) with 20 endangered species. Players compete to collect 6 different resource types: Food (from Plains), Oil (from Oceans), Metal (from Mountains), Wood (from Forests), Electricity (from Electricity plants - built anywhere) and People (from Cities - built anywhere). They do this by buying and exploiting the land: spreading out from a starting land to adjacent land tiles. The cost of land grows as more of it is exploited. Players must also pay the cost of Waste that is generated by exploiting lands and extracting resources.

A turn has two phases. Phase 1 involves: Approving resource projects (3 available each turn, drawn from a deck), Buying land, Buying/Selling resources, Upgrading lands and/or performing Acts of Conservation (building habitat bridges, relocating species, recycling waste). Phase 2 involves: Recycling waste at Recycling plants (built anywhere) and Paying Waste dues (mandatory).

—description from the designer
